Package FileManager

Interface dataWriter

All Known Implementing Classes:
CsvFileWriter
public interface dataWriter
The dataWriter interface defines methods for writing data to a CSV file. Implementations of this interface provide functionality to modify specific cells, update specific rows, or append rows to a CSV file.

This interface can be implemented to handle data writing operations for CSV files stored locally or within specific locations in a project.

Since:
2024-11-6
Version:
1.0
Author:
Tan Guang Wei

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    deleteRow(String fileName, int row)
    Deletes an entire row in the CSV file.

    Writes data to a specific cell in the CSV file.

  • Method Details

    • writeData

      void writeData(String fileName, int row, int column, String data)
      Writes data to a specific cell in the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the CSV file to write to.
      row - The row index of the cell to write, where the first row is 0.
      column - The column index of the cell to write, where the first column is 0.
      data - The new data to write into the specified cell.

      This method will locate the specified cell in the file and update its contents with the new data provided. If the specified row or column is out of bounds, the implementation should handle it appropriately.

    • writeRow

      void writeRow(String fileName, int row, List<String> data)
      Writes or updates an entire row in the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the CSV file to write to.
      row - The row index to update or write data to, where the first row is 0.
      data - A list of strings representing the new row data to be written. Each element in the list represents a cell in the row.

      If the specified row index exists, this method will overwrite the entire row with the new data. If it does not exist or is out of bounds, the implementation may handle it by appending or ignoring, depending on the intended behavior.

    • writeRow

      void writeRow(String fileName, List<String> data)
      Appends a new row to the end of the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the CSV file to write to.
      data - A list of strings representing the new row data to be appended. Each element in the list represents a cell in the row.

    • deleteRow

      void deleteRow(String fileName, int row)
      Deletes an entire row in the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the CSV file to write to.
      row - The row index to update or write data to, where the first row is 0.

      If the specified row index exists, this method will delete the entire row. If it does not exist or is out of bounds, the implementation may handle it by appending or ignoring, depending on the intended behavior.
